turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: If it please Your Honor, we <u>hope</u> to settle this matter.

turns.speaker: JUDGE GARNETT
turns.text: By God you <u>will</u> settle it! If you force this case to trial, young man, you'll regret it for the rest of your natural-born days... Now, Joseph. What would you require to settle this matter today?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Reinstatement at full salary. Back pay covering the period of unemployment and...

turns.speaker: JUDGE GARNETT
turns.text: Hold it, Joe.  He wants to come back to work, Chuck.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Based on what my client would have earned over the next three years, including benefits and projected raises, and the extraordinary cost of medical care for someone with Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome... We would settle today for the very fair amount of one million five hundred thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: JUDGE GARNETT
turns.text: Very good, Joe. Now, Belinda, I've got a figure over here, of one million, five. I...

turns.speaker: JUDGE GARNETT
turns.text: In this courtroom, Mr. Miller, justice is blind. To matters of race, creed, color, religion. And sexual orientation.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: With all due respect, Your Honor... We don't live in this courtroom, do we?

turns.speaker: JUDGE GARNETT
turns.text: No. We don't... However, as regards this witness, I'm going to sustain the defense's objection.

turns.speaker: JUDGE GARNETT
turns.text: Let's continue.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You had one guy "like that?"

turns.speaker: JUDGE GARNETT
turns.text: This would be a good time to break for the day...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Your Honor? May I have ten minutes in re-direct?

turns.speaker: JUDGE GARNETT
turns.text: Beckett?

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: It's good to be King, hey Charles?

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Kings are out of fashion. I'd rather be thought of as a benevolent tyrant.  It's an anti-trust action.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Andy. It seems that something has come over you, lately: A kind of... stupor, a fogginess, a lack of focus... Earth to Andy. Anybody home?

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: Helloooo...

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Julius!

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: Dr. J.!

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Andrew brought AIDS into our offices, into our men's room. He brought AIDS to our annual goddamn family picnic.

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: We ought to be suing him.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Wait a minute. The man was fired for incompetence, not because he has AIDS. You didn't know he was sick, did you, Bob?

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: Holy Shit. Did you, Bob?

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: You'll be sorry, Beckett.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Andy, you don't want this.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: ... to suit their personal desires, and the rest of us have to live with it.

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: You have to make a decision: is this guy partner material?

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: ... interview every employee, support staff, associates, partners. Did <u>any</u> of them know Andy was sick? <u>How</u> did they know? Did he tell them? Did they notice something was wrong with his appearance? None of this information got to the managing partners. We know that. Make sure everyone else does too... And Beckett: I want to know everything about his personal life. Did he frequent those pathetic bars on Camac Street?

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: What about other homosexual facilities, whatever they are?

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Charles...

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: What deviant groups or organizations did he secretly belong to?  What is it, Bob?!

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Let's settle with Andy and put this whole tragic mess behind us.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: That's kind of... extreme, Walt. Andy's private life is none of our business.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Bob. You're trying my patience. Andrew Beckett is making his private life our business. We gave him Kronos. Did he say, "I'm sick. I might not be able to see this through?"

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: He was doing a great job.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Bob. I must ask you to shut the fuck up. Did Andrew Beckett say "I might not be able to serve our clients to the <u>best of my ability</u>?" He said nothing. And now, Andrew Beckett proposes to haul me into a court of law, to sling accusations at me, in full view of the entire, Philadelphia, judicial establishment. My God.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: I've discovered something interesting, Charles.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: ... keep them from that area, on grounds of relevancy.  What, Bob?

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: No matter how hard I try, I can't lose a file in my computer.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Very interesting, Bob. Let's make a note of that. Andy didn't lose the complaint in his computer. He never put it in. He lied about that, too.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Charles...

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: If you feel differently, Bob, you should say so, when you're called to the stand. After all, this isn't a conspiracy.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: I didn't tell the others, I was afraid to...

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: ... But now, we're standing up for ourselves...

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: ... But we shouldn't have fired him...

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: ... It's time to get this society back on track!

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Don't wanna miss this.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Lookit. Lookit!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Gonna lose everybody out here....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: He died fast. And if we got any choice, that's the way we should all go out.  Don't you cry for Johns. Don't you dare.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: What? What is it?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: It's a fucking staircase! Go over it! GO OVER IT!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You came for us....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Yeah, yeah -- we're all fuckin' amazed. Anyone not ready for this?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Probably okay to talk to me now.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Not sure where to go. I was just runnin' away when this whole thing started.  Where you goin'?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Not sure. I was just runnin' away when this whole thing....

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Audrey? Oh, Audrey....

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: <u>What</u>?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Tell me that was you.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Okay, it was me. What'd I do now?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Assailing my fragile sense of security, that's what.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Oh, Lord....

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: It was just somebody else. From the crash. He was just....

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You mean...tonight? With all those things still out there?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Oh, sure. Why not? Sounds like a hoot.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Liquid oxygen canisters inside. Start ripping them out. Quick hits only -- try to make it last.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Well, is someone coming for us? Or are we all just gonna die of exposure or dehydration or sunstroke or maybe even something worse?  Hey, you don't have to worry about scaring me.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Bottle-count.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Four fulls, one half. That mean we're halfway there? I hope?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I didn't want you to leave me there... back at the ship...that's why I didn't say anything....

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: No, we'd never....Oh, God, honey, you shoulda told me sooner.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Bring the light!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: What're they doing? What're <u>we</u> --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Leave the sled, let's go, go, go!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Three full bottles. But almost time to refill.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Doesn't seem like enough to turn back on, does it?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Tell me about the sounds. You told them you heard something right before....  If you don't talk to me, Johns'll take another crack at it -- at your skull.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: 'Mean the whispers?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: What whispers?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: The ones tellin' me to go for the sweet spot -- just to the left of the spine, fourth lumbar down. The abdominal aorta. What a gusher. Had a cup on his belt, so I used it to catch a little run-off. Metallic taste to it, human blood. Coppery. But if you cut it with peppermint schnapps, that goes away. Course, that's more for winter. Summertime, I take mine straight.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: All you people are so scared of me -- an' most days, I'd take that as a compliment -- but it ain't me you gotta worry about now.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Show me your eyes.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You did this? To yourself?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Slam doctor. Well, we called him "doctor."

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Heard about it. Just never seen it.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Fairly fuckin' ironic, wouldn't you say? Slamlight's so dim that you go and get your eyeballs taken out and shined up -- then you wind up here. Three ass-kick suns.  Maybe I did do a few people. But not this one. No ma'am, not this time.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Then where is he? He's not in the hole. We looked.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Look deeper.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Power cells.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: They're coming.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Strange, not doin' a run-up on the main drive yet.  Strange unless he told you the particulars of my escape.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I got the quick-and-ugly version.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: An' now you're worried about a repeat of history?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Entered our minds.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: I asked what <u>you</u> thought.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You scare me, Riddick. That's what you wanna hear, isn't it? There, I admit it, Can I get back to work now?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Why, what'd you hear?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Well, guess if it was trickeration he'd just do me, huh? Then again...I am worth twice as much alive.  Didn't know? Johns ain't a cop. Oh, he's got that shiny badge an' all, but nah -- he's just a merc and I'm just a payday. That's why he won't kill me. The creed is greed.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Riddick...was thinkin' we should make some kind of deal. Just in case, you know, this actually --

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Had it with deals.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: But I just wanted to say --

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Nobody's gonna turn a murderer loose. I fuckin' knew better.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Been a long time since anyone's trusted me. That's somethin' right there.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: We can, can't we? Trust you?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Actually...  That's what I been askin' myself.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Where are the sand-cat tracks? Why aren't we still following them?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Saw something I didn't like.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: What do you see? Riddick?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Hunger. I see 60 years of hunger.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Riddick? What the hell are you --

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: <u>Listen</u>.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Canyon ahead. I circled once to buy some time to think.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Think about what?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: What about her?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: What it's gonna be like when we hit that canyon. With her bleeding.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Back to the ship, huh?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Get out of our way.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: So everybody huddles together till the lights burn out? Until you can't see what's eating you? That the big plan?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: How many you see?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: One or two.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Audrey?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: We're just here to carry your light, aren't we? Just the torch-bearers.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Let's drop back an' boot up.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: As fast as you can.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You sure you can keep --

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: As fast as you can.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: So where the hell's God now, huh?  I'll tell you where! He's up there PISSING ON ME!

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Riddick? How close?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Tell me the settlement is right there! RIDDICK, PLEASE!

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: We can't make it.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Strong survival instinct. Admire that in a woman.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You're not leaving. Not until we go back for the others.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I promised them we'd go back with more light. And that's exactly what we're gonna do..

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Think you've mistaken me for somebody who gives a fuck.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: What, you're afraid?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Confusin' me with Johns now -- fear was <u>his</u> monkey. I only deal in life and death. All that stuff in between? Some shade of grey my eyes don't see.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: <u>I trusted you</u>, Riddick. Goddamn, I trusted that some part of you wanted to rejoin the human race.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Truthfully? I wouldn't know how.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Just come with me!

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Got a better idea. Come with <u>me</u>.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: They're already dead. Get on board.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You're fuckin' with me. I know you are.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: 'Course I am -- but doesn't mean I won't leave you here. If you believe anything about me, better be that.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: No, you see, I <u>promised</u> them...I have to...I have to go and....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Step aboard, Carolyn.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I can't....I can't....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Here. Make it easy on you.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Don't do this to me....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Just give me your hand.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: But they...they could still be....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: No one's gonna blame you. C'mon. Take my hand and save yourself, Carolyn.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: You'd die for them?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I would try for them.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: You barely know them.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: But I'm human. I know you view that as a weakness, but I'm sorry -- I <u>do</u> feel fear, theirs too. Goddamnit, Riddick -- yes. I would die for them.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: This is it? Booze? <u>That's</u> what you have to drink?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: 200-year-old single-malt scotch is to "booze" as foie gras is to "duck guts."

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: What do my eyes see?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: It's starting....

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Just a suggestion, but perhaps we should flee.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Cargo hold, everyone in the cargo hold. lesgo, lesgo, lesgo.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Christ, you don't know what's out there!

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: I know what's in here!

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: There....

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Like the light is scalding it.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: It hurts them. Light actually hurts them....

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: ...one cutting torch...one handlight here, two more in the cabin...I <u>think</u> two more....

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Spirits. Anything over 45 proof burns well.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: How many bottles?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Not sure. Ten?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Those umbrellas, the ones that mist. Would they burn?  If you got a receipt?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Possibly.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Awright. So maybe we'll have enough light.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: I hate to kill a beautiful theory with an ugly fact, but that sand-cat won't run at night.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: We'll have to carry the cells...drag them...whatever it takes.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Let's move.  Just a detour. He'll get us there.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Can we switch?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: What, switch what?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: I think I twisted my ankle running backwards like that. And I'm not sure I can....  Okay, that's a lie. I just don't want to be alone back there anymore. If you could just give me a few minutes up front here --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Hey, who?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Hey, me. Over here.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Amazing. I'm Johns.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Carolyn Fry. I'd shake hands, but...

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: And him?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Big Evil?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: We just keep him locked up forever?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Be my choice. Already escaped once from the max-slam facility on --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I don't need his life story. Is he really that dangerous?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Only around humans.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: S'matter?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Little swamp-flu from the Conga system. Never shook it with all this cryo-sleep.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: A very good sign.  That's Riddick's direction. You do <u>not</u> wanna be caught in the dark with this guy.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Thought you found his restraints over there. Toward sunset.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Which means he went toward sunrise.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Tell me it's not a mirage.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Probably makes it worse. Dehydrates you even more.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Probably right.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: No, no, I wanted to get away.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: So I noticed. Never seen a "captain" quite so ready to leave her ship.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Better keep moving....

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: What'd Owens mean? 'Bout not touching the switch?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Hey. You can tell me, Carolyn.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Promise me. Swear to me you won't --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: You see anybody else here? Just between you and me.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: During the landing...when things were at their worst...Owens was at his best. He's the one who wouldn't let the pilot dump the passenger cabin.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: So now you know.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Fuck. Guess I'm more glad to be here than I thought.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Didn't bite.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Thought he might be coolin' it in the boneyard -- could either double-back to the ship or slip in behind us. So I left the bottle out as bait.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: No juice, looks like it's been laid up for years. But we might be able to adapt --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Sorry. Thought I heard something.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Like my pistola.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: ...I don't play that...I don't play that so just try again. C'mon, Riddick, tell me a better lie....

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Ease up, ease up. JOHNS! Just tell me what....

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: He used that?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Sir Shiv-a-lot. He likes to cut.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: So why isn't it all bloody?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I assume he licked it clean.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I <u>know</u> what happened -- he went off on the guy, buried him on the hill somewhere, and now he's trying to --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Let's just be sure.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I <u>am</u> sure. Look, murders aside, Riddick belongs in the Asshole Hall of Fame. He loves the jaw-jackin', loves making you afraid, 'cuz that's all he has. And you're playing right into --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: <u>We're gonna find the body</u>, Johns. Christ, you're a cop. Why am I tellin' you this? We gotta go down and find it.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Well, don't ask me to.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Thought you didn't believe his story.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I don't. But that ground looked none too stable, and I don't want anyone --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Nobody else is going down but me, okay?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Hey. Bein' ballsy with your life now doesn't change what came before -- it's just stupid.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: What, you think I'm doin' this to prove something?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: You said it, not me. Let's just not let one bad call lead to another.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Thanks for the tip, Johns.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Little ratty-ass.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Nothing we can't repair -- so long as the electrical adapts.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Okay, that should buy us a sys-check. But we'll need more cells.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: 15 6-gigs here...90 gigs total...other ship carries 20-gig cells, so...five. Five total to launch.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: 25 kilos each, huh?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Rag it, Riddick. Nobody wants your theories on --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: So what happened? Where are they, then?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Let's board this up and get the hell gone. They seem to stick to the dark, so if we stick to daylight, should be all --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: 60 years ago.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Wha'?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: ...need those cells from the crash ship. Shit, still gotta check out the hull, patch the wings --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Let's wait on the power cells.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Wait for what? Until it's so dark we can't even find our way back to --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: We're not sure <u>when</u> it happens, so let's not --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: <u>Get the fucking cells over here</u>, Johns. What's the discussion?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: He can pilot?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Hijacked a prison transport, made a helluva good run 'fore I tracked him down.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Okay, maybe that's a <u>good</u> thing. Maybe I can use him to help with --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: He also figured out how to kill the pilot, Fry.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You said we were going to trust him now. You said there was a deal.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: That's what I said.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Oh, this is a dangerous game you're playing, Johns.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: May've noticed chains don't work on this guy. Only way we're truly safe is if he believes he's goin' free. But if he <u>stops</u> believin' --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You mean, if he learns that you're gonna royally fuck him over.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: -- we need a fail-safe. Bring the cells over at the last possible minute -- when the wings are ready, when we <u>know</u> we're ready to launch.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You know, he hasn't harmed any of us. Far as I can tell, he hasn't even lied to us. Just stick to the deal, Johns. Let him go if that's what it --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: He's a murderer. The law says he's gotta do his bid.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Dancin' on razor blades here...

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I won't give him a chance to grab another ship -- or to slash another pilot's throat.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You're not a real cop, are you? Just some mercenary who goes around talkin' about the law like --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I never said I was.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Never said you were a hype, either.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: You have a little caffeine in the morning, I have a little morphine. So what?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: And here you got two mornings every day. Wow, were you <u>born</u> lucky?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Not a problem unless you're gonna make --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: <u>You</u> made it a problem when you let Owens die like that. When you had enough drugs to knock out a fucking mule-team.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Owens was already dead. His brain just hadn't caught on to that fact.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Anything <u>else</u> we should know about you, Johns? Christ, here I am lettin' you play games with our lives when --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: My first run-in with Riddick. Went for the sweet-spot and missed. They had to leave a piece of the shiv in there. I can feel it, sometimes, pressing against the cord.  So maybe the care and feeding of my nerve-endings is my business.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You coulda helped. And you didn't.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Stop it, stop it, STOP IT!

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: 'Sokay, 'sokay. I killed it.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Oh, lady. If you're in your right mind, I pray you go insane.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: We can stick to the plan. If we get four cells back to the skiff, we're off this rock.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Look, we gotta think about everyone now -- the kid especially. How scared is she gonna be out there?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Oh, don't use her like that, for a smoke screen.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Smoke screen for what?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: For your own fear.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Hey. Why don't you rag your hole for two seconds and let someone else come up with a plan that doesn't involve MASS SUICIDE?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: How much you weigh, Johns?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: What the hell's it matter?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: 79 kilos.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Because you're 79 kilos of gutless white meat, and <u>that's</u> why you can't come up with a better plan.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: He'll lead you over the first cliff. You know that, don't you?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: We're just burnin' light here.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: You give him the cells and the ship -- and he will leave you. He will leave you all out there to die.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I don't get it, Johns. What is so goddamn valuable in your life that you're worried about losing? Huh? Is there anything at all? Besides your next hype?  Got no right to be so scared. Neither one of us.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: So you noticed too?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Riddick. <u>Riddick</u>.
